Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision to deny refugee protection based on failure to prove identity was patently unreasonable
Governing_Law: Section 106 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Facts: Applicant provided conflicting testimony about identity documents, including discrepancies in birth certificates and NICs
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision was not patently unreasonable
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Boardâ€™s decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to establish credible identity documentation
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant's testimony and documentation
Credibility_Assessment: Inconsistencies in identity documents undermined credibility
Relief_Sought: Overturning of Board's denial of refugee status
Governing_Rule: Board must assess acceptable documentation or reasonable explanation for absence under Section 106
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide consistent and credible identity proof
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status but failed to convincingly establish identity through credible documentation
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed inconsistencies in submitted documents and testimony
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 106 - Failure to meet identity verification requirements
Evidence_Issues: Discrepancies in birth certificates and NICs, conflicting testimony
Legal_Provision: Section 106 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Documents found unreliable due to inconsistencies
Decision_Rationale: Credibility undermined by inconsistent evidence; decision not patently unreasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of acceptable documentation and implausible explanations for discrepancies
